Uses of Class
com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ConfigurableBase

  • Packages that use ConfigurableBase 
    Package Description
    com.ojcoleman.europa.algos.neat
    Contains classes that implement the NEAT evolutionary algorithm.
    com.ojcoleman.europa.algos.vector
    Contains classes for genotypes that are constructed from genes and alleles that comprise a vector of double values.
    com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable
    Contains classes for building a - typically hierarchically structured - collection of parametrised components that can be configured via a JSON configuration file.
    com.ojcoleman.europa.core
    Contains mostly interfaces and abstract classes that form the core components of an evolutionary algorithm.
    com.ojcoleman.europa.evaluators
    Contains various implementations of Evaluator.
    com.ojcoleman.europa.monitor  
    com.ojcoleman.europa.populations
    Contains various implementations of Population.
    com.ojcoleman.europa.rankers
    Contains various implementations of Ranker.
    com.ojcoleman.europa.speciators
    Contains various implementations of Speciator.
    com.ojcoleman.europa.transcribers.nn  
    com.ojcoleman.europa.transcribers.nn.integration  

    • Uses of ConfigurableBase in com.ojcoleman.europa.algos.neat

      Subclasses of ConfigurableBase in com.ojcoleman.europa.algos.neat 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  NEATAllele<G extends NEATGene>
      Base class for representations of NEAT alleles.
      class  NEATEvolver
      Implements the NEAT evolutionary algorithm.
      class  NEATGene
      Base class for representations of NEAT genes.
      class  NEATGenotype
      Genotype for the NEAT algorithm.
      class  NEATNeuronAddMutator
      Mutator that adds neurons to a NEAT genotype.
      class  NEATNeuronAllele
      Represents the mutable parameters of a neuron in a NEAT neural network.
      class  NEATNeuronGene
      Represents a neuron in a NEAT neural network.
      class  NEATRecombiner
      Implements recombination as described by the NEAT evolutionary algorithm (See https://www.cs.ucf.edu/~kstanley/neat.html) but generalised to any number of parents: if one parent dominates all others then the new genotype will inherit the genes of this parent, otherwise the genes from all parents will be inherited (except in the case where adding a synapse would result in a cycle and recurrent networks are not allowed).
      class  NEATSpeciator<G extends NEATGenotype,S extends Species<G>>
      Base class for Speciators for NEATGenotypes.
      class  NEATSpeciatorKMeans 
      class  NEATSpeciatorOriginal
      Implements speciation according to the original NEAT speciation method with a few difference: A target number of species may be specified with speciationTarget, in which case the speciation threshold will be adjusted automatically. Individuals are added to the closest matching species, not the first matching species found. It can handle alleles with multiple parameters (not just weight or bias). Parameter values may be normalised (see normaliseParameterValues) when calculating the distance between two genomes.
      class  NEATSpecies 
      class  NEATSynapseAddMutator
      Mutator that adds synapses to a NEAT genotype.
      class  NEATSynapseAllele
      Represents the mutable parameters of a synapse or connection in a NEAT neural network.
      class  NEATSynapseGene
      Represents a synapse or connection in a NEAT neural network.
      class  NEATTranscriber
      Transcriber for the NEAT algorithm.

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ParametrisedGeneType
      A component that encapsulates the configuration for a type of Gene and/or {Allele} that define a set of evolvable parameters.
      class  VectorAllele<G extends VectorGene>
      Class for Alleles represented by a vector of (double precision) floating-point values.
      class  VectorFunctionEvaluator
      Base class for evaluators that evaluate VectorFunctions.
      class  VectorFunctionTranscriber<G extends Genotype<?>>
      Base class for transcribers that produce VectorFunctions that take a double vector as input and output a double vector.
      class  VectorGene
      Interface for Genes represented by a vector of (double precision) floating-point values.
      class  VectorGeneGenotype<A extends VectorAllele<?>>
      Base class for Genotypes that comprise VectorGene and VectorAlleles.
      class  VectorMetadata
      Class for containing meta-data about each value in a numeric vector.
      static class  VectorMetadata.Element
      Stores meta-data for a Vector element.
      static class  VectorMetadata.ElementDefaults
      Stores meta-data for the default settings for the Elements of a Vector.
      class  VectorMutator

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ComponentBase
      A base class for classes that represent a user-configurable component of the software.
      class  PrototypeBase
      In Europa the class to use for many types of object is determined at run-time, for example the class to use for an individual or a genotype.
      Constructors in com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable with parameters of type ConfigurableBase

      ConfigurableBase(ConfigurableBase configurable)

    • Uses of ConfigurableBase in com.ojcoleman.europa.core

      Subclasses of ConfigurableBase in com.ojcoleman.europa.core 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Allele<G extends Gene>
      Base class for representations of alleles within a Genotype.
      class  DefaultEvolver<G extends Genotype<?>>
      A default Evolver that selects DefaultEvolver.parentsProportion of the highest ranked Individuals from the Population, or each Species if applicable, and produces new members via recombination and/or cloning and mutation to replace the current members.
      class  DummyEvaluator
      Dummy evaluator used for printing configuration options.
      class  DummyGenotype
      Dummy genotype used for printing configuration options.
      class  DummyMutator
      Dummy mutator used for printing configuration options.
      class  DummyTranscriber
      Dummy evaluator used for printing configuration options.
      class  Evaluator
      Base class for classes used to evaluate the fitness of Individuals in the evolutionary algorithm.
      class  Evolver<G extends Genotype<?>>
      Base class for classes that generate the (@link Individual)s for an initial Population and then produce new Individuals based on recombination and mutation of existing members of the population (once they've been evaluated and ranked).
      class  Gene
      Base class for representations of genes within a Genotype.
      class  Genotype<A extends Allele<?>>
      Represents the inheritable genetic material of an Individual.
      class  History
      Base class of classes that store information about previous generations of populations and individuals.
      class  Individual<G extends Genotype<?>,F extends Function<?,?>>
      Represents an individual in the Population used in the evolutionary algorithm.
      class  Monitor
      Base class of classes that monitor the state of the evolutionary process.
      class  Mutator<G extends Genotype<?>>
      Base class for all classes that mutate a Genotype.
      class  Parallel
      Utility class for performing parallel iteration over generic Collections or anything that implements the Iterable interface.
      class  Population<G extends Genotype<?>,F extends Function<?,?>>
      Represents the population of Individuals in the evolutionary algorithm.
      class  Ranker<G extends Genotype<?>,F extends Function<?,?>>
      A component that ranks the individuals in a population.
      class  Recombiner<G extends Genotype<?>>
      Base class for all classes that mutate a Genotype.
      class  Run
      Initiates and manages an evolutionary run, implementing the basic core cycle of evaluating a population and then producing a new population according to the results.
      class  Speciator<G extends Genotype<?>,S extends Species<G>>
      Base class of classes that divide a Population into Species.
      class  Species<G extends Genotype<?>>
      Represents a species in the evolutionary algorithm.
      class  Transcriber<G extends Genotype<?>,F extends Function<?,?>>
      A Transcriber transcribes a Genotype to a "phenotype" Function.

      Implementation of Monitor that prints out the configuration for the Run in JSON format to a file called config.json.

      Implementation of Monitor that records information about the fittest individual.
      class  OverviewMonitor
      Implementation of Monitor that prints out a line of statistics every N generations to the standard output (console).

    • Uses of ConfigurableBase in com.ojcoleman.europa.rankers

      Subclasses of ConfigurableBase in com.ojcoleman.europa.rankers 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  NSGAII<G extends Genotype<?>,F extends Function<?,?>>
      This class implements the non-dominated sorting selection method (according to rank and then crowding comparison operator) based on the multi-objective genetic algorithm NSGA-II as described in DEB, Kalyanmoy ; PRATAP, Amrit ; AGARWAL, Sameer A.
      class  SimpleRanker<G extends Genotype<?>,F extends Function<?,?>>
      This is a simple ranker that only considers the primary fitness objective when ranking individuals.

      class  NoSpeciation<G extends Genotype<?>>
      The default speciator simply assigns all individuals of the population to a single species.

      class  ParametrisedNeuralNetwork
      A wrapper for neural network implementations whose configuration is defined by a set of labelled numeric parameters.

    • Uses of ConfigurableBase in com.ojcoleman.europa.transcribers.nn.integration

      class  BainNeuralNetwork
      A wrapper for Bain neural networks.
      class  BainNNConfig
      Describes additional configuration parameters for Bain neural networks.
      class  BainParametrisedGeneType
      Encapsulates the configuration for a type of Gene and/or {Allele} that defines a set of evolvable parameters for a component type in a Bain neural network, such as the neurons or synapses.
